primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human subject seeks 'spiritual success' (calm, poise, strength) by intentionally positioning God as a focal point to achieve stability and growth.

tekstueel_bewijs: I have set the Lord always before me
We need to be challenged to rise higher
We need to set the Lord always before us
source of his strength of soul
The Lord has called us to higher things
We desperately need the presence of God to convict us
give us a sense of well-being
because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved
the Bible is a mirror in which we may see ourselves

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily internal stagnation or the weariness of life, rather than cosmic sin or death requiring a Savior.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Soteriological' background where God restores the soul, though it is framed as a result of the primary program's discipline.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon fluctuates between God acting (Psalm 23) and the human 'setting' God (Psalm 16), making God's action conditional on human focus.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must take things into our own hand

voorbeelden: You and I need to pray...
enabled by constant vision of God

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward obligation (Devoir). It assumes that if the hearer knows 'how' (Savoir) and is told they 'must' (Devoir), they will achieve the result.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the human act of 'setting' God before the self to trigger God's helping presence.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; sin is seen as 'loathsome' but primarily as a barrier to personal growth rather than an ontological death.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using biblical language, the 'engine' of the sermon is anthropocentric. God is the 'Helper' (Adjuvant) used by the human 'Subject' to achieve the 'Object' of spiritual stability.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We do need the Lord ever before us to correct us.
because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Psalmist is presented as a 'successful' spiritual athlete whose 'technique' (setting the Lord) we should emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the one who sets Himself before us in the Incarnation when we were unable to look up.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform spiritual disciplines to ensure God's presence.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where human initiative precedes divine support.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon starts with secular success and tries to map that logic onto the spiritual life, creating a clash between 'achievement' and 'mercy'.
spanning_punten: The 'jigger of gin' anecdote frames success as a human habit, which clashes with the later 'mercy of God' language.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: we need also to be challenged to rise higher as living souls

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is a resource for the subject's growth rather than the primary actor of new birth.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'slouching' or 'slumping'—a lack of effort.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'how-to' guide for spiritual maintenance where the human is the Subject and God is the Tool.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the one 'setting' God.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the Subject who 'sets' His Son before us.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We must set the Lord before us,' use 'In Christ, the Lord has set Himself before us so that we cannot be moved.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'successful athlete' of faith.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the hearer as the lost sheep in Psalm 23 rather than the one who 'attains' the Shepherd.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how God's grace gives the power to change, rather than the duty to change.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Describe sin as a power we cannot escape by 'setting' anything.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: A stronger opponent necessitates a stronger Savior (Subject switch).

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (rising higher) precedes or replaces Soteriology.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Proclaim God's finished work (Psalm 23) as the ground that allows the response of Psalm 16.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a strong pastoral heart but relies too heavily on the 'success' metaphor, which inadvertently turns grace into a reward for focus.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is engaging; semiotically, it is a work-plan.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Psalm 16 is accurate, but the homiletical application shifts the 'weight' of the verbs to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that God is functionally a 'Helper' actant here, which subordinates the Divine to human goals.

appendices.notities: The use of 'Success' in the title sets a secular-competitive actantial frame that persists throughout.
